repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body: If two Cython modules are being imported simultaneously there's a possible race. This ensures that the type that's set up first is always used.

comment_data.body:
I think the `goto bad` case now leaks a reference to this string.
```suggestion
    Py_DECREF(py_object_name);
```
Could `verify_type` be a separate function, called twice if necessary?
Don't think so - `goto bad` jumps back to `done`
It already kind of is - there was just a chunk of code left out of it for some reason. I've hopefully improved that.

I think we always use `NULL` in hand written code.
```suggestion
    py_basicsize = NULL;
```

commit.message:
Fix a possible race when setting up the common types

If two Cython modules are being imported simultaneously there's
a possible race. This ensures that the type that's set up
first is always used.
